title: Frontend-utvecklare som vill revolutionera marknaden för videodistribution
description:
JOBBESKRIVNING

Vill du sluta koda tråkiga formulär och hemsidor? Vill du jobba med gränssnitt som de ser ut på film? Är du lika sugen på att jobba med användarcentrerad datadriven design som med interaktiva kartbaserade applikationer? Läs vidare! Med den här tjänsten kommer du in på en dynamisk internationell startup med några av världens största varumärken som kunder. Hive Streamings vision är att transformera videodistributionsmarknaden och här behöver vi din hjälp!

OM TJÄNSTEN

Academic Work söker för Hive Streamings räkning en frontendutvecklare som lockas av att arbeta med de senaste ramverken för gränssnittsprogrammering. Hive Streaming leverar en mjukvarutjänst för videodistribution som möjliggör användandet av video för företag i tätt samarbete med partners som Microsoft (Skype for Business) och andra stora spelare på videomarknaden. Vill du arbeta med fullstack-utveckling i en organisation där du får jobba i teknikens framkant är det hit du ska söka dig! Hive Streaming arbetar med några av världens största varumärken och arbetsmiljön präglas av entreprenörskap.

Den här rekryteringsprocessen hanteras av Academic Work och Hive Streamings önskemål är att alla samtal och mail kring tjänsten går till Academic Work.

Tjänsten är en direktrekrytering vilket innebär att rekryteringsprocessen sker genom Academic Work men du kommer anställas direkt hos Hive Streaming.

ARBETSUPPGIFTER

Som frontendutvecklare kommer du att arbeta med de gränssnitt som omger Hives avancerade grundteknologier. Du kommer att vara delaktig i utvecklingen av nästa generations webb-baserade verktyg i de videodistributionslösningar som Hive Streaming erbjuder till sina kunder. Verktygen används för en mängd olika ändamål i de egenutvecklade programmen, exempelvis för administration, övervakning och statistik. Du kommer att arbeta med de senaste teknikerna inom webbutveckling med t.ex Typescript och Angular.js. För visualisering kommer du att arbeta i d3.js.

Du kommer till exempel att:

  • Arbeta med systemutveckling i JavaScript, HTML och CSS
  • Vara delaktig i arbetet för användbarhet och UX

Tjänsten passar dig som har ett stort intresse för systemutveckling och för att utforska de nya teknikerna. Du är tekniskt lagd, nyfiken och en stor vilja av att utvecklas inom området. Vi söker både dig som är nyexaminerad från en eftergymnasial utbildning inom systemutveckling/datateknik eller dig med ett par års erfarenhet. Det viktigaste är ditt driv och ditt intresse.

VI SÖKER DIG SOM

  • Har en naturlig fallenhet och en stor passion för webb- och systemutveckling
  • Har goda kunskaper i JavaScript, HTML och CSS. Dessa har du fått genom studier och egna projekt och eventuellt också genom något tidigare arbete. Du har projekt/portfolio att visa upp
  • Har en eftergymnasial utbildning exempelvis inom datateknik, systemutveckling eller motsvarande
  • Har grundläggande kunskaper i både Windows och Linux
  • Har mycket goda kunskaper i engelska eftersom det är arbetsspråket

Det är meriterande om du:

  • Arbetat i något JavaScript-ramverk som AngularJS eller liknande
  • Har kunskaper i Typescript
  • Har erfarenhet av Ruby on Rails
  • Har en förståelse för http-baserad streaming-teknik

Som person är du flexibel och trivs med att arbeta i en agil och föränderlig miljö. Du kan skifta fokus och prioritera om. Vidare är du självgående, driven och har förmågan att själv driva och ansvara för att dina arbetsuppgifter utförs med god kvalitet och till utsatt deadline.

ÖVRIG INFORMATION

  • Start: Snarast enligt överenskommelse
  • Omfattning: Heltid
  • Lön: Månadslön enligt överenskommelse
  • Placering: Södermalm, centrala Stockholm
  • Kontaktuppgifter: Jenny Rydberg, rekryteringskonsult, recruitmentstockholmsouth@academicwork.se.

Academic Work är Home of the Young Professionals. Vi vänder oss till dig som är akademiker och fortfarande studerar på högskola/universitet, är nyutexaminerad eller har några års arbetslivserfarenhet. Hos oss kan du arbeta som uthyrd konsult på specifika kunduppdrag eller bli anställd direkt hos ett kundföretag via vår rekryteringsverksamhet. Läs mer på www.academicwork.se.

SKYDD FÖR DEN PERSONLIGA INTEGRITETEN När du skickar in din ansökan till Academic Work godkänner och samtycker du till att Academic Work behandlar dina personuppgifter enligt Personuppgiftslagen. Läs mer under vår PuL-sida.
how_to_apply:
Sök tjänsten genom att klicka på länk nedan: https://www.academicwork.se/annons/frontend-utvecklare-som-vill-vara-med-och-revolutionera-marknaden-for-videodistribution/14994246

Vi går igenom urvalet löpande och annonsen kan stängas ner innan tjänsten är tillsatt om vi gått över till urvals och intervjufasen.

Vi tar inte emot ansökningar via mail men har du specifika frågor kring tjänsten besvaras dessa på recruitmentstockholmsouth@academicwork.se. under kontorstid. Skriv annonstiteln i rubriken och kopiera gärna in länken till annonsen i ditt mail. För generella funderingar kring din ansökan/vår rekryteringsprocess finns vi ofta tillgängliga i chatten här på webben under vardagar så hör gärna av dig där!

title: Senior Android Engineer
description:
Job Description

We are looking for an Android developer responsible for the development and maintenance of applications aimed at a vast number of diverse Android devices and geographies. Your primary focus will be the development of Android applications and their integration with back-end services. You will be working alongside other engineers and developers working on different layers of the infrastructure. Therefore, commitment to collaborative problem solving, sophisticated design, and creating quality products is essential.

Skills & Qualifications

  • 3 or more years experience building sophisticated Android apps
  • Strong knowledge of Android SDK, different versions of Android, and how to deal with different screen sizes
  • Familiarity with RESTful APIs to connect Android applications to backend services
  • Strong knowledge of Android UI design principles, patterns, and best practices
  • Experience with offline storage, threading, and performance tuning
  • Ability to design applications around natural user interfaces, such as “touch”
  • Familiarity with the use of additional sensors, such as gyroscopes and accelerometers
  • Knowledge of the open-source Android ecosystem and the libraries available for common tasks
  • Ability to understand business requirements and translate them into technical requirements
  • Familiarity with cloud message APIs and push notifications
  • A knack for benchmarking and optimization
  • Understanding of Google’s Android design principles and interface guidelines
  • Proficient understanding of code versioning tools, such as Git
  • Familiarity with continuous integration

title: Senior iOS Engineer
description:
Job Description

We are looking for an iOS developer responsible for the development and maintenance of applications aimed at iOS devices including mobile phones and tablets. Your primary focus will be development of iOS applications and their integration with backend services. You will be working alongside other engineers and developers working on different layers of the infrastructure. Therefore, a commitment to collaborative problem solving, sophisticated design, and the creation of quality products is essential.

Skills & Qualifications

  • 3 or more years of professional experience building sophisticated iOS apps in Objective-C and Swift (latest)
  • Extensive experience building custom views and layouts
  • Extensive experience with iOS Frameworks (AVFoundation including custom A/V capture, SFSpeechRecognizer, NSURLSession, Photos, etc)
  • Extensive experience with Social Network SDKs (Facebook, Twitter, WeChat, etc)
  • Experience with custom iOS Extensions (Keyboard, iMessage, Share, etc)
  • Experience with mobile databases (Realm), threading (GCD), and performance optimization (Instruments)
  • Experience with Xcode target configuration (.xcconfig)
  • Experience with Objective-C and Swift interoperability
  • Experience with Localization
  • Experience with TDD
  • Familiarity with RESTful APIs and connecting iOS applications to backend services
  • Familiarity with C, C++ and OOP
  • Familiarity with push notifications (UNUserNotificationCenter)
  • Familiarity with fastlane deployment
  • Understanding of Apple’s design principles and interface guidelines
  • Attention to detail with respect to software design and architecture
  • Proficient understanding of code versioning tools such as Git

title: Head of Design
description:
Job Description

At VIDY we apply design as a calculated practice - human centered and data inspired.

As our Head of Design, you will work closely with the entire product team and will define our design process, tooling, and delivery system with an accent on iterative and data driven decision making.

Your primary goals will be to design and manage the development of the next generation of mobile websites, apps, keyboards, APIs and other interfaces across multiple platforms such as iOS, Android and mobile web.

We expect you to have an evolved understanding of how people use their devices, the flexibility to adapt to new technologies, and a robust toolkit.

You will be reporting to and strategizing with the CEO and engineering stakeholders within the company to determine and execute long-term product goals.

Day-to-day, you will manage a team of two designers and lead the design team to execute on your vision. You will be responsible for highly usable and intuitive interface creation. Any concept you create will be brand-consistent across all mobile experiences that our company provides to our end users.

Skills & Qualifications

  • Strong graphic design skills, with a good understanding of typography, intuitive layouts, and color theory.
  • Excellent understanding of user-experience design for mobile and the web, technology trends, Apple’s human interface design guidelines, Android design, demonstrable design skills, and ability to show relevant work
  • Proven ability to quickly deliver high quality designs to the team at large and our in-house design team
  • A team player who can easily adapt in a rapidly changing environment
  • Experience in designing high quality consumer websites, apps and digital products with a background in bringing ideas from conception through to market adoption with design.

title: Mid Customer Success Engineer
description:
Job Description

As Customer Success Engineer you will be the face and voice of the company at conferences, meetings with potential partners and a point of reference for existing ones.

Your goal will be to make our customers successfull integrating our APIs in their products, helping them writing code, sending examples, documentation, answering question they might have.

You will be pro-active in writing our documentation and knowledge base and keeping up to date with new features and releases.

Skills & Qualifications

  • Experience with multiple languages, JavaScript, Python, PHP, Objective-C
  • Experience with implementing code following specs and documentation
  • Bonus: Fluent in Chinese
  • Bonus: Experience with working with Chinese Customers
  • Bonus: 2+y of experience as customer success engineer

title: Senior Data Engineer
description:
Job Description

We are looking for a Data Engineer that will help us discover the information hidden in vast amounts of user data, and help us make smarter decisions to deliver even better products.

Your primary focus will be in applying data mining techniques, doing statistical analysis, and building high quality prediction systems integrated with our products as well as developing internal A/B testing procedures to continually test and improve our products.

As a data engineer, you will be in charge of data ingestion (events), periodic dumps from different databases and all the automation and tooling. VIDY is built on top of a 100% Cloud Native infrastructure, all data processing and extraction runs in a container and at large scale.

Part of your responsibilities will be setting up daily, weekly, and monthly reports containing all the answers the engineering and product team need.

The ultimate goal is to have enough automation to go from question to answer in few minutes, presented in a way that is clean and easy to understand for everybody.

Skills & Qualifications

  • You need to fluently speak Math
  • Two or more years of experience with big data
  • Experience with Google Cloud services including BigQuery
  • Experience with multiple databases like MongoDb, redis, MySQL etc
  • Excellent understanding of machine learning techniques and algorithms, such as k-NN, Naive Bayes, SVM, Decision Forests, etc.
  • Experience with Cloud Native technologies, containers and the docker ecosystem
  • Experience with open source software
  • Experience with git and git workflows connected to CI/CD
  • Experience with github, pull requests and code review
  • Bonus: Experience with Node.js
  • Bonus: Experience with Go
  • Bonus: Experience with Tensorflow

title: Senior Front-end Engineer
description:
Job Description

We are looking for a Front-End Web Developer who is motivated to combine the art of design with the art of programming. Responsibilities will include translation of the UI/UX design wireframes to production cross-browser code that delivers a near-native experience to our users. You will work with the Head of Design and bridge the gap between graphical design and technical implementation, taking an active role on both sides and defining how our website (desktop and mobile) and internal dashboard look and function.

Our front-end code utilizes the latest in build tools to ship highly optimized code to our users. You will get the chance to work with the latest HTML5 APIs such as Media Capture and Service Workers while still progressively supporting browsers that don’t support such APIs. This is your chance to be one of the industry leaders when it comes to delivering video on the web.

Skills & Qualifications

  • Three or more years experience as a senior front-end engineer
  • Proficient understanding of web markup, including HTML5, CSS3
  • Solid understanding of the DOM and its underlying APIs
  • Good understanding of advanced JavaScript libraries and frameworks, such as Angular, Vue, and React.
  • Familiarity with progressive web application principles
  • Familiarity with progressive enhancement principles
  • Basic knowledge of image authoring tools, to be able to prepare assets for web use
  • Familiarity with tools such as as Sketch, Gimp, or Photoshop is a plus
  • Experience working with video on the web is a big plus
  • Proficient understanding of cross-browser compatibility issues and ways to work around them
  • Proficient understanding of code versioning tools, such as Git
  • Strong understanding of SEO principles and ensuring that application will adhere to them

title: Mid Back-end Engineer
description:
Job Description

As a Backend engineer, you will be both maintaining current features and implementing new ones.

You will be working on a highly automated environment with test suites and CI/CD that is 100% Cloud Native.

You will be working with Containers and Kubernetes in a large scale distributed system with peaks of 25,000 CPUs running simultaneously. Our designs need to survive billions of API calls keeping the response time below 50ms.

You will have the chance to reach millions of users with your code and face challenges that only few companies have the luxury to have.

A large chunk of our code base is written in Node.js, up to date to the latest release available on a monthly basis. You will be writing modern JavaScript with no callbacks and only promises async/await.

Skills & Qualifications

  • Two plus years of experience with Node.js and modern JavaScript
  • Strong Experience working with unix like machines
  • Strong Experience with writing test suites and testable code
  • Strong Experience with writing open source modules and github
  • Strong Experience with git workflows, PR, code review
  • Medium Experience with system design and microservices infrastructure
  • Medium Experience with Docker, Containers, and Docker compose workflows
  • Medium Experience with MongoDb, Redis, Elasticsearch
  • Bonus: Knowledge of Domain Driven Design
  • Bonus: Knowledge of Idempotency patterns when working with data and eventual consistency

title: Senior Software Engineer, Core Services Platform
description:
DESCRIPTION: Changing the world is all in a day's work at Apple. If you love innovation, here's your chance to make a career of it. You'll work hard. But the job comes with more than a few perks.

Are you a techie with a passion for software? Are you excited at the prospect of building expertise in mobile advertising and its technology stack? If so, we’d like to talk to you!

At Apple, we work every day to create products that enrich people’s lives. Our Advertising Platforms group makes it possible for people around the world to easily access informative and imaginative content on their devices while helping publishers and developers promote and monetize their work. Our technology and services power advertising in Search Ads in App Store and Apple News. Our platforms are highly-performant, deployed at scale, and setting new standards for enabling effective advertising while protecting user privacy.

We are seeking an experienced software architect/senior engineer who is passionate about creating high-performing, scalable, well-designed back-end systems that are the foundation for critical internal and customer-facing platforms at Apple. As a senior developer you will take ownership of a solution from beginning to end and deliver great software to help drive usage and monetization within Apple News and other platforms.

The Core Services Platform team designs and builds best of breed systems for dealing with our complex and ever-growing data and infrastructure needs that deliver advertising data to Ad Server and Big Data pipelines. The team is directly responsible for systems that are used by thousands of advertisers, publishers and developers and has high visibility in the mobile advertising space.

Key Qualifications:

  • 5 or more years of industry experience in server-side Java programming (working in large-scale systems a plus)
  • Experience in designing and implementing RESTful APIs 
  • Experience and deep understanding of scalable distributed systems like Cassandra, Solr, Kafka and/or Hadoop
  • Demonstrated experience architecting, developing and deploying internet-scale, distributed and mission critical services
  • Experience working on complex problems and systems where scalability and performance are extremely important (every millisecond counts)
  • Experience with Spring/Hibernate is desirable
  • Relational database experience and demonstrated abilities in SQL and data modeling is required. Proficiency with NoSQL databases is desired as well
  • Strong problem solving and debugging skills are required
  • Ability to communicate effectively, both written and verbal, with technical and non-technical cross-functional teams
  • Results oriented and deadline driven
  • A desire to work in a fast-paced and challenging work environment
  • Prior experience in advertising industry is a huge plus

Description: Core Services Platform team encapsulates the entire data model, and provides an abstraction layer upon which all other parts of the platform are built. We are the glue between a number of teams within Ad Platforms and also integrate with other software teams around the company. 

As a key contributor to this team, you will design and develop secure and scalable back-end systems that deliver key business data to ad servers and big data pipelines. You will build and maintain interfaces used by both internal systems and thousands of developers and advertisers world-wide.

We are looking for engineer who is self-motivated, has great design instincts, and enjoys working cross-functionally. The right candidate will enjoy high-performing, elegant systems from the ground up, in close partnerships with various teams around you. He or she will also possess keen judgement in selecting technologies and building the right solution for the interesting challenges we get to solve here.

Education: Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or equivalent is required Master's degree preferred

Apple is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer that is committed to inclusion and diversity. We also take affirmative action to offer employment and advancement opportunities to all applicants, including minorities, women, protected veterans, and individuals with disabilities.

title: Principal UX Designer
description:
Ever wanted to be part of a tech-startup from the ground up? A new ADVENTURE where you're among the first 100 employees at a FULLY funded startup developing NEW, never before offered WORLD CLASS cloud video solutions that'll GLOBALLY change video tech forever? Your opportunity is here! We're diligently preparing for our PRODUCT LAUNCH and we're looking for deeply experienced PRINCIPAL UX DESIGNER who's NOT just looking for a new "job," but instead seeks to MAKE HISTORY by passionately developing new products that'll change entire industries and the use of video technologies around the world! If you're ready and selected, we offer much of the standard perks that startups offer, such as an amazing open workspace, along with relocations (2 months free apartment if hired), visa services (after one year), 10 day hiring process if hired, and sign-on bonuses! Job purpose Understand customer & partner needs to re-invent & cloud services that are the most powerful, intuitive and compelling interactions in the industry.

Primary Responsibilities

  • Based on the market input, be the voice of the customers (servant leader) in the fast-paced agile process consisting of several autonomous product development teams. Ensure maximum customer value creation through groundbreaking user experience and visual design.
  • Influence product managers, software architects, developers and other disciplines to broaden and strengthen UX understanding and importance.
  • Translate business objectives and customer needs into exceptional user & partner experience.
  • Responsible to all UX activities spanning the entire design and development process, from early requirements gathering to final fit-and-finish review.
  • Translate the business strategy to execution delivering innovate user experience designs, addressing customer and end-user needs. Job tasks
  • Visiting customers, interviewing end-users and observing them performing daily tasks, create UX resources such as different flows, blueprints, and interactive prototypes.
  • Produce, design documents that explain your design to clients and developers participating in user testing sessions and interviewing customers with relevant skills and responsibilities.
  • Evangelize and demonstrate best practices in heuristics, usability and user-centric design.
  • Translate business objectives and user needs into exceptional user experiences.
  • Identify and plan the user experience research needed to meet the strategic business and product goals.
  • Visit customers and end-users to understand their goals and current pain points
  • Share insights from field studies and surveys with internal stakeholders
  • Create UX deliverable's including; customer ecosystem models, personas and end-user scenarios, interaction models, blueprints, consumer journey maps, annotated wireframes describing interactions of components, details regarding priority and states (Primary, Secondary, Disabled, Enabled) of controls, wire flows showing pages transitions, pages respond to changes in browser width, contents and default values of drop-downs and other controls, default page presentation, mapping of personas to menus/features/functionality, HTML/CSS representations of controls, PNG/SVG representations of visual artifacts, color palette & fonts (type, color, size), brand style guide - all based on user data driven decisions.

Job Description

  • Ensure design goals are aligned with end-user needs through focus groups, usability tests, card sorting A/B tests or other user research methods for validation.
  • Validate that release goals are meet via usability and benchmark studies through global early adopter programs
  • Research and monitor current trends and best practices related to user interaction and experience design. Professional qualifications
  • Extensive experience working with usability and user-centered design in a software company.
  • Master education within human factors, psychology, design, or a related field (PHD preferred)
  • 8+ years of experience with UX research for software products or services, preferably with enterprise solutions and new product/service development, assessment, and launch.
  • A track record of strongly influencing product and service designs and directions based on end-user needs (an extensive portfolio is required containing both interaction design, as well as visual design examples).
  • Track recordi of designing end-to-end SaaS experiences using user-centered design and Agile UX methodologies.
  • Experience with and thorough understanding of fundamental usability methods like contextual inquiry, heuristic evaluations, cognitive walkthrough, user surveys and usability tests
  • Experience with organizing and sharing end-user insights via customer models and persona descriptions
  • Experience using UX tools to craft conceppting strategies and deliverable's. Personal skills
  • Team player with energy, humor, and creativity that shares the Arcus Global passion for what great design and technology can do for our customers.
  • Committed to excellence and independent with excellent collaboration skills
  • An expert listener - continous self improver and works by soliciting, responding to, and incorporating feedback on how things can be better regardless of internal or external seniority level.
  • Effective at communicating and skilled at presenting and selling creative ideas to partners and internal teams.
  • Self-motivated and able to plan and drive own tasks
  • Possess great communication skills, technical knowledge, and connects easily with others.
  • Able to rapidly develop artifacts to help communicate with others and gain support.
  • Results driven and able to drivel insights, shared with the design and development teams
  • Develops solutions to ensure that the end user’s goals are reflected in the product or service design.
  • Passionate about great user-centered design, technology, and emerging UX practices and tools
  • Has a positive mindset and are able to share knowledge with other disciplines
  • Works great in teams and possess good interpersonal skills
  • Self-assured, driven, confident and goal-oriented – set clear directions without dictating the technical solution.
  • Ability to effectively delegate and translate needs into daily routine operations
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills
  • Strong technical, mathematics, and analytical skills.
  • Solves problems effectively - sees innovation opportunities in everything
  • Strong negotiation skills, applicable for both engineering and GTM teams
  • Strong operational execution with ability to build and manage cross-group, cross-cultural relationships
  • Partner effectively with other Canon Group and Milestone teams Job Type: Full-time

title: Software Engineer, Geospatial Insights
description:
Overview

Azavea is a civic technology firm based in Philadelphia that uses geospatial data to build software and data analytics for the web. As a B Corporation, our mission is to use advanced geospatial technology for civic, social, and environmental impact. Most of our customers are local governments, non-profit organizations, and academic or federal research projects. We build custom web applications; perform geospatial analysis; manage and contribute to several open source civic software projects (DistrictBuilder, OpenTreeMap, GeoTrellis, and others). Our engineers work across the technology stack, from modern browser-based front-ends to robust service-based backends residing on scalable infrastructure.

We’re looking for a software engineer that is passionate about building applications that will have a positive impact – someone interested in public service, but not necessarily in working for a government or a non-profit organization. We are looking for generalists who thrive on working in a variety of technology environments, and want to build user-focused applications that sit on top of well-engineered infrastructure.

We’re excited about what we do, we're growing, and we hope you will join us.

Skills & Requirements

The Geospatial Insights Team

Azavea has a handful of engineering teams, all of which develop web software for processing and visualizing geospatial data. The teams differ in terms of the specific projects they develop and whether they are primarily focused on products or professional services. The Geospatial Insights team currently focuses on developing two web products: HunchLab and DistrictBuilder. HunchLab is a SaaS offering for law enforcement agencies that applies statistics and machine learning to create a proactive patrol management system used to improve public safety in communities across the country. DistrictBuilder is an open source web application for engaging the public with the legislative redistricting process. The Geospatial Insights team does most of its work with JavaScript (AngularJS), Python (Django), Scala, and PostgreSQL. All supporting infrastructure for applications resides on Amazon Web Services (AWS) and is delivered with a combination of Ansible, Docker, Terraform, and a wide variety of AWS services.

What You’ll Do:

  • Build features, APIs and web clients based on wireframes and designs developed by our UX Design team.
  • Engage in multidisciplinary work that applies an agile process (scrum board, daily stand-ups and two-week iterations) to design, architect, develop, test and deploy software.
  • Optimize database, service and client performance to create applications with both functional and responsive user experiences.
  • Build and deploy services in a repeatable way to AWS.
  • Contribute to both a growing company and to the open source communities that support our work.

You should:

  • Know how to build and support scalable web applications in Python/Django, Scala/Akka HTTP, or other language-specific web framework.
  • Demonstrate fluency in core web technologies (HTML/CSS/JS) and contemporary JavaScript libraries like AngularJS and React.
  • Understand how AWS, Docker, and Terraform help our infrastructure.
  • Be comfortable with virtualization or containerization in a UNIX environment.
  • Be excited about working with a small, collaborative team on meaningful projects.

You get extra points for:

  • Background in math and statistics.
  • Experience with open source or commercial geospatial toolkits like OpenLayers, Leaflet, GeoServer, PostGIS, CARTO, ArcGIS, and GoogleMaps.
  • Experience with mobile apps (iOS, Android or React Native).
  • Experience scaling applications within AWS.
  • Knowledge of distributed computing frameworks, like Hadoop, Spark, and Amazon MR.
  • Demonstrating your open source or other community service contributions.

You’ll notice that we don’t say “X-Y years of experience” or “M.S. in Computer Science.” Formal credentials like these are not irrelevant, but we are primarily looking for people who have had experience successfully building sophisticated web applications. You might have had these kinds of experiences without a college degree. Or you may be just out of school but worked your way through school and had some great co-op experiences. Or you might have a math or humanities background but a have a great head for software development. These are all potentially great backgrounds, and we’d be interested in hearing from you.

Office and Benefits

Our Philadelphia office is located in a brightly lit office on the 5th floor of a converted factory building in the Callowhill neighborhood, a short walk from Center City, the Reading Terminal Market, and SEPTA subway and regional rail stations. For bicyclists, we have in-house bike parking, a shower and lockers. It’s an open office plan with several smaller rooms for team meetings, private space and concentration time. You get a top-end Linux workstation or Apple laptop with extra monitors. We have flex-time to deal with personal stuff, and most people work a 40 - 45 hour week on a regular schedule. After the first six months, our staff can also spend up to 10% of their time on a geospatial open source, professional development, or R&D project. For example, some of our colleagues are contributors to the PostGIS, OpenLayers, GDAL and GeoTrellis projects. Other research projects have included improving application delivery tool chains; using FFT for fast kernel density estimation; working with Spark to develop machine learning tools; and using GPUs for faster raster data processing. Once a quarter, we all get together to share our research and learning with our colleagues.

We offer a salary commensurate with skills and experience and a benefits package that includes:

  • Fully subsidized health care, dental, prescription plan, including for spouse/partner and children
  • Fully subsidized life and long term disability insurance, plus voluntary short term disability insurance
  • Medical reimbursement plan to cover what the health insurance does not
  • Retirement plan with matching percentage
  • Almost 4 weeks paid vacation plus additional paid sick/personal time off
  • Family and medical leave
  • Flexible work schedule
  • Paid maternity and paternity leave
  • Child care subsidy
  • Paid time off for voting and volunteering
  • Education assistance plan
  • Student loan assistance
  • Public transit and biking reimbursement plans
  • Monthly guest lectures with lunches on the house
  • 10% time for research or learning projects
  • Profit-sharing bonus plan
  • Financial transparency through an open book policy
  • Kind, capable and thoughtful colleagues

We welcome qualified candidates from all walks of life and value diversity in our company, and we prohibit discrimination based on race, color, religion, ancestry, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, veteran status, military service, disability unrelated to job requirements, marital status, or domestic partner status.

title: Senior DevOps Engineer
description:
Ever wanted to be part of a tech-startup from the ground up?  A new ADVENTURE where you're among the first 100 employees at a FULLY funded startup developing NEW, never before offered WORLD CLASS cloud video solutions that'll GLOBALLY change video tech forever?  Your opportunity is here!  We're diligently preparing for our PRODUCT LAUNCH and we're looking for deeply experienced SENIOR DEVOPS ENGINEERS who are NOT just looking for a new "job," but instead seek to MAKE HISTORY by passionately developing new products that'll change entire industries and the use of video technologies around the world! If you're ready and selected, we offer much of the standard perks that startups offer, such as an amazing open  workspace, along with relocations (2 months free apartment if hired), visa services (after one year), 10 day hiring process if hired, and sign-on bonuses! If you're passionate about developing the very best cutting-edge DevOps experience for users, then this is your OPPORTUNITY to convert our Arcus Cloud vision to reality by being the most senior DevOps developer & informal technical go-to person for DevOps and techOps focused engineers. Your job will be 50% development and 50% as a lead.

Primary Responsibilities

Be the 1st DevOps Engineer who will shortlist and partner with our CPO to hire and develop strong and highly effective DevOps engineers for our newly established U.S. engineering site - the headquarters and origin of the Arcus vision, development, and governance of the cloud-based solution. Be part of and collaborate with software engineering teams to deploy and operate our service, help automate and streamline our operations and processes, build and maintain tools for deployment, monitoring and operations and troubleshoot and resolve issues in our dev, test and production environments. Plan operational activities, provide technical leadership in the development of a new Cloud based service, frequently operating at the leading edge of technology as well as mentoring Cloud operations engineers.

Qualifications and requirements

A Masters in Computer Engineering, Science or equivalent and 7+ years of solid background in the fundamentals of software development, and have a deep understanding of best practices & data models in various backend frameworks/technologies/services/ & systems. Experience in an end to end role having focused on bridging strategy to tactical planning to execution as well as produced code & activity get into technical details on daily basis. Excellent devOps practices and a notable track record having worked across organizational boundaries, delivering automated, scalable, secure SaaS solutions. Experience to scale a SaaS solution from idea to first general availability to global scale. SaaS experience with strong understanding of Microservices architectures, patterns and practices. Experience with GCP or any public cloud (Azure, AWS etc); a wide variety of open source technologies and cloud services such as Jenkins, Github, Teamcity, or Pagerduty; SQL based databases like MySQL, Maria DB, Oracle, MS SQL; networking principles and TCP/IP; scripting languages (e.g. PowerShell, Python, or Bash)

Preferably sound OO design and programming skills in e.g. Java or Python or Go or C++ or Node.js Ability to think big & strategically, but prioritize to stay on top of tactical execution with a can-do and sense of urgency attitude.

  • Relocation services will be provided
  • Including furnished apartment for up to 2 Months
  • Sign-on Bonus available
  • Max 10 hiring process (if selected)
  • Visa / Green Card support after 1 year of employment

title: Senior Front End Engineer Developer
description:
Ever wanted to be part of a tech-startup from the ground up? A new ADVENTURE where you're among the first 100 employees at a FULLY funded startup developing NEW, never before offered WORLD CLASS cloud video solutions that'll GLOBALLY change video tech forever? Your opportunity is here! We're diligently preparing for our PRODUCT LAUNCH and we're looking for deeply experienced FRONT END ENGINEERS who are NOT just looking for a new "job," but instead seek to MAKE HISTORY by passionately developing new products that'll change entire industries and the use of video technologies around the world!

If you're ready and selected, we offer much of the standard perks that startups offer, such as an amazing open workspace, along with relocations (2 months free apartment if hired), visa services (after one year), 10 day hiring process if hired, and sign-on bonuses!

Primary Responsibilities

Deliver the best-in-class customer experience by designing, developing, integrating, deploying, and troubleshooting on software front-end technologies for developing cloud solutions using server-less architecture as well as Microservices, Event-driven systems, polyglot databases, cloud based tools, infrastructure and storage. Collaborate with principle Engineer, UX designer, Senior Product Owner(s) and several development teams throughout the product lifecycle producing timely and top-quality deliveries on our cloud platforms. Be a go to person, mentor and coach for other less senior frontend engineers. The job will be 95% development and 5% as a lead.

Professional Qualifications

Must have 10+ years experience, with XHTML, HTML 5, JavaScript, CSS, CSS3 and general Web 2.0 techniques Must have 3+ years experience with at least Angular 2, Express, Hapi, React, or Redux Must have 3+ years experience of building large Enterprise level web applications Must have 5+ years of interacting with Rest APIs at scale Must have 3+ years experience with Responsive Design using frameworks such as Bootstrap, etc. and strong competencies with design patterns Must have 8+ months of experience with maintaining and building Microservices Architecture in production using containers Must have 10+ years experience producing code, planning, forecasting, and get into technical details on a daily basis Preferably 10+ years experience OO design and programming skills, such as, Java or Python or Go or C++ or Node.js

A Master in Computer Engineering, Science or equivalent and 5+ years of solid background in the fundamentals of software development, and have a deep understanding of best practices in various client side frameworks & technologies. Personal Skills

Take great personal pride and showcase unfailing passion on behalf of our customers when developing efficient, easy, and scalable web interfaces for feature rich enterprise cloud services. Ability to think big & strategically, but prioritize to stay on top of tactical execution with a can do and sense of urgency attitude – takes pride work.

Strong execution focus with ability to build and manage strong cross-group relationships. Job Type: Full-time

title: Commerce Engineer, Apple Media Products
description:
DESCRIPTION: Changing the world is all in a day's work at Apple. If you love innovation, here's your chance to make a career of it. You'll work hard. But the job comes with more than a few perks.

The Apple Media Products Commerce Engineering team is looking for an experienced, talented and self-motivated software engineer to lead several data architecture and technical compliance efforts across the commerce landscape. Join our exciting engineering team that has been leading the digital distribution industry by constantly developing innovative features to grow and expand the iTunes Store, App Store, iBooks Store and services such as Apple Music.

The position requires someone comfortable with all aspects of the software design lifecycle and experienced with high performance distributed systems. If you thrive in a dynamic cross-functional environment and are able to pivot with constantly evolving requirements and new technologies, you’ll love it here.

Key Qualifications:

  • 5-10 years of relevant work experience designing, implementing, and supporting highly scalable and highly reliable applications and web services.
  • Extreme attention to detail and ability to self-audit work
  • Exceptional Java and object-oriented programming skills
  • In-depth knowledge of relational database systems (Oracle preferred) as well as NoSQL data stores and data modeling
  • Familiarity with data privacy and data protection regulations and standards

Description: Customer privacy is very important at Apple and we take tremendous care in how we collect, use, disclose, transfer, and store the information of our customers. You will lead an engineering team within Apple Media Products (AMP) Commerce Engineering to develop technical solutions to global data privacy regulations covering several areas including data access/consent and data retention. You will work cross-functionally with several teams including Apple-wide program management, legal and privacy, anti-fraud, big data and data warehousing, design, UI, operations, and production support on designing, building or enhancing scalable systems that are used across the commerce data landscape.

You will be challenged to manage, evolve, and invent new features to address ever-changing regulations. In addition, you must master new technology quickly, be comfortable working in a fast-paced environment, have a “can-do” attitude. Superior negotiating skills and excellent communication skills will be critical in this role.

Education: BS in Computer Science/Software Engineering or equivalent. MS preferred.

Apple is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer that is committed to inclusion and diversity. We also take affirmative action to offer employment and advancement opportunities to all applicants, including minorities, women, protected veterans, and individuals with disabilities.

title: Senior Big Data Engineer
description:
DESCRIPTION: Changing the world is all in a day's work at Apple. If you love innovation, here's your chance to make a career of it. You'll work hard. But the job comes with more than a few perks.

As a member of the Siri Data Engineering Operations team within the Siri organization, you will be faced with highly complex issues in a large scale, distributed system environment. In order to ensure a reliable and rewarding Siri experience, you will be empowered to develop and design new solutions heavily focused on system automation. We look for talented engineers in both the Operations and Development space to bring these unique solutions to production at a rapid pace. From an Operations perspective, this makes us the most successful personal assistant in the industry.

Key Qualifications: •Knowledge of the Linux operation system (OS, networking, process level) •Understanding of Big Data technologies (Hadoop, Hbase, Spark, Kafka, Flume, Hive, etc) •Understanding of one or more object-oriented programming languages (Java, C++) •Fluent in at least one scripting language (Shell, Python, Ruby, etc.) •Strong verbal and written communication skills •Passionate about being a part of a tight-knit Operations team

Description: The Siri Data Engineering Operations team manages the platform for both ingestion and analytics of worldwide Siri events. To accomplish this, we build automation tools and services to prevent failures and page out individuals when there really is a problem, not just noise.

Our engineers not only work closely with Operations, but also with the development and analytics engineers within Siri, as well as outside organizations. We build data pipelines for maximum efficiency, scalability and reliability to allow domain specific engineers to focus on their specialties. A successful candidate will have experience in being a Systems Administrator that has moved on to development and automation in their career.

  • Operate Apple’s largest infrastructure supporting millions of Siri customers at double digit PB scale

  • Troubleshoot complex issues across the entire stack

  • Design and develop automation frameworks to handle both development and production events at scale

  • Advise other teams (within and outside of Siri) on technical direction

  • Make changes to our environment with the purpose of pushing Siri to the next level

Education: B.S. degree in Computer Science or 3+ years of building data pipelines experience or equivalent.

Additional Requirements: (Nice to have)

  • Java JVM performance tuning/optimizations
  • Mesos compute platforms and job schedulers

Apple is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer that is committed to inclusion and diversity. We also take affirmative action to offer employment and advancement opportunities to all applicants, including minorities, women, protected veterans, and individuals with disabilities.

title: Lead Software Engineer - Backend
description:
Join us and help revolutionise an already groundbreaking product. You’ll have the space to iterate and innovate, and the time to experiment and craft your skills and our product. Working together, we can get things done properly. We can help change the world. Constant development of Mendeley Reference Manager is a key part of this challenge. You’ll be working on the tool that allows researchers to connect with one another, collaborate, organise, read, annotate and cite documents. As part of Elsevier, you'll be applying the latest web technologies and advanced information retrieval techniques. All to help extract knowledge from the world’s largest medical and scientific knowledge base.

Lead Software Engineer - Backend

You’ll be working with the latest cross platform technologies including an Electron framework, great design, and a Java microservices cloud architecture with a REST API. An expert on backend development and scalable, RESTful APIs, you will line manage a team of software engineers with different skill sets. Centred around a common functional area of the Mendeley product base, you will be working with experts in their fields. At the same time you will also play a significant part in the mentoring and development of junior team members. We deal with a considerable amount of data, including a billion user documents in SQL and NoSQL databases. So you will be a strong hands-on Java coder, able to share solid engineering practices with your colleagues. You will be working closely with product managers and UX professionals to create user-centred products. You’ll also contribute to the agile process, ensuring that there is a shared vision for the team, that tasks are well defined and actionable, and that everyone knows what they’re working on.

Minimum requirements

You will have worked as a technical lead, or have taken a leading role within a development team. This means you will have great team skills, including the ability to get your idea across and to work with colleagues to get the ‘best answer’.

You should have:

  • Proven expertise in Java
  • Experience with AWS or a similar cloud provider
  • A history of building and taking products to market
  • A bias for simplicity, elegance, scalability, robustness and maintainability in code and systems
  • Experience in leading and mentoring junior colleagues

You should be comfortable designing architectures that allow rapid iterations to support our agile development process, whilst considering future requirements and the big picture when planning and developing new applications and features. Quality is important to you and you support a culture of pair programming, test driven development, devops, code reviews and constant communication. You should enjoy acquiring new skills and expertise as required by the project.

Join our team

We know that every tech company is trying to make the workplace more exciting and more fun. But we believe we combine a great place to work and outstanding colleagues, with something even more rewarding. We’re using the latest technology and managing large amounts of data to help over 6 million researchers, clinicians and engineers tackle the biggest challenges facing humankind. You could be part of our team.

title: Web Developer for European Molecular Biology Laboratory
description:
The European Molecular Biology Laboratory (EMBL) is one of the highest ranked scientific research organisations in the world. The Headquarters Laboratory is located in Heidelberg (Germany), with additional sites in Grenoble (France), Hamburg (Germany), Hinxton near Cambridge (UK), Rome (Italy) and Barcelona (Spain).

EMBL is looking for a Web Developer who will actively participate in the development, deployment, and application of algorithms and software for analysis and visualization of big imaging mass spectrometry data. This position is open within two research projects: the European Horizon2020 research project METASPACE on Bioinformatics for Spatial Metabolomics and the NIH research project Spatial Metabolomics for Kidney.

You will be a critical part of the dynamic, interdisciplinary, international and cross-cultural Alexandrov team where we work at the intersection of biology, chemistry, and computer science. We use advanced software engineering to develop professional open-source software for data science, computational biology, and data visualization. Our results were published in top-level bioinformatics and methods journals and were highlighted by various scientific journals (Nature, PNAS, PLoS) and public media (CNN, Der Spiegel, Wired, Health, BusinessInsider).

You will contribute to the forefront of science at the intersection of imaging, computational biology, and big data analysis. You will develop web applications for analysis and visualization of big molecular data generated by imaging mass spectrometry. You will work with users from throughout the world applying our tools in biology, medicine, and pharma. You will work with partners developing other online services, in particular those from European Bioinformatics Institute (EBI). We love using modern software technologies including (but not limited to) Python 3, scipy, pandas, GraphQL, Node.js, View.js, Docker, CircleCI, git, Amazon Web Services, Apache Spark and Ansible. Our main software product is METASPACE: http://annotate.metaspace2020.eu, https://github.com/METASPACE2020.

We offer a goal-oriented environment, flexible working hours and great career opportunities. English is the working language.

Qualifications and Experience

We are looking for a university graduate with a degree involving computer science, mathematics, or any equivalent computational component. Essential qualifications: strong programming skills, knowledge of Python, experience with or desire to learn JavaScript (including server side), familiarity with CSS and HTML magic, interest in or practical knowledge of modern web frameworks, willingness to work in a small interdisciplinary team. Having any of the following qualifications is a plus: experience with Amazon Web Services, knowledge of data visualization, interest to science.

Additional Information

EMBL is an inclusive, equal opportunity employer offering attractive conditions and benefits appropriate to an international research organisation with a very collegial and family friendly working environment. The remuneration package comprise a competitive salary, a comprehensive pension scheme, medical, educational and other social benefits, as well as financial support for relocation and installation, including your family.

Please note that appointments on fixed term contracts can be renewed, depending on circumstances at the time of the review.

title: Infrastructure & Backend Developer
description:
DailyKos, the leading online progressive blogging and activism platform, is looking for an Infrastructure & Backend Developer. DailyKos is a great place to work-- your code will be used by hundreds of thousands of people a day who care deeply about progressive politics and are working to effect real political change. We provide an extensive feature set that extends from blogging to activism and beyond. If you want a job that provides more than just a technical challenge, we'd love to hear from you.

The job offers a flexible work environment, the ability to work remotely on a distributed team of self-sufficient collaborators, competitive salary and benefits, and we provide an Apple MacBook Pro or your comparable preferred hardware. Our organizations commitment to personal growth reduces churn and encourages a very rewarding long term position. We have an energized team filled with great people with different backgrounds.

We are seeking a self-sufficient, operations-at-scale experienced remote worker who:

*can comparatively weigh tradeoffs of different configuration management, scheduling, and infrastructure design approaches
*has a deep understanding of distributed systems from the network level up
*has experience with AWS deployments relying on EC2 primitives (VPCs, subnets, security groups, instances, load balancers, auto scaling groups, ...) and preferably RDS too.
*has experience with convergent and congruent configuration management systems and can articulate the pros or cons of each
*has exposure to functional programming such as with the Nix expression language or Haskell
*has exceptional operational troubleshooting capabilities
*has operationally managed stateful services like Kafka or ElasticSearch and their upgrades, or other complex stateful JVM infrastructure components with a production-level SLA
*has interest in working on backend services or monitoring systems which are currently written in Ruby and Haskell. Haskell coaching, pointers, reviews available for your growth, not required upfront. :)
*has production experience deploying Nix/NixOS systems at scale (highly preferred).

At Daily Kos, we believe that the diversity of ideas, experiences and cultures that our employees contribute to our organization help us be more effective in our work, and we are proud to be an inclusive and equal-opportunity workplace. We're a company that loves learning and supports growth and training for all our employees.

To apply, please send an email to tech_jobs@dailykos.com with the name of the position in the subject line, a cover letter, code sample or github repo and your resume (include your LinkedIn profile link).

title: Senior Software Engineer
description:
Come help develop the future of software used in industrial automation. In this position, you would join our core product development team. Together, we work to build our primary product, Ignition.

This position is focused on implementing and maintaining network protocols for communicating with industrial controllers (PLCs, RTUs, etc…) as well as the system responsible for bridging data from those implementations into the Ignition platform. Responsibilities include new feature and protocol development as well as the maintenance and enhancement of existing functionality.

We are a tight-knit team of developers working every day to delight customers worldwide with a product they actually need. If this sounds like something you’d like to be part of we look forward to talking to you.

Responsibilities

  • Work with software engineering team to help guide direction and design of future releases
  • Implement new features and changes with an eye for security, reliability, and performance
  • Help maintain software by fixing issues identified by support and QA teams
  • Perform complex and precise troubleshooting to pinpoint root causes for reported issues
  • Participate in agile development process (SCRUM)
  • Perform code reviews to help verify changes made by other developers
  • Follow Java and object-oriented design industry best practices

Requirements

  • B.S. in Computer Science, or equivalent experience
  • Minimum 5 years of programming experience
  • Strong Java 8 skills
  • Experience writing server and networking code
  • Experience writing highly concurrent multithreaded code
  • Modern toolchain and source control familiarity, e.g. Maven/Gradle and Git/Hg
  • Excellent communication skills
  • Excellent analytical and troubleshooting skills

Skills Not Required, But a Plus

  • Experience with OPC Classic or OPC UA
  • Experience with industrial automation fieldbuses or protocols such as Modbus, EtherNet/IP, Omron FINS, Siemens S7, Emerson/Fisher ROC, ABB Totalflow (DB/DB2), etc…
  • Experience with PLCs and/or PLC programming
  • Any other relevant experience in industrial automation

Inductive Automation, LLC is an equal opportunity employer, and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, sex, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, and status as a protected veteran or individual with a disability.

Verification of US employment eligibility required

title: Senior Web Application Engineer (full-stack)
description:

If you’re right for this position, you will be comfortable working with remote team members while actively seeking opportunities for collaboration. You feel right at home crafting a reliable, well-tested API for internal and third party use. You care about the details when it comes to deployment, commit history, refactoring, design patterns, and other development practices. You have a standards-centric view of the Web, know its limitations and possibilities, and care about performance and progressive enhancement.

We’re looking for an individual who is excited to form the foundation of a growing team. Our team will enable individuals, corporations and Aperian service professionals to work effectively across boundaries.

Requirements: We love working with good people who care about our customers and each member of the team. On top of that, we’re looking for someone with experience with the following:

Top

-Javascript/NodeJS

-PHP

-React

-ExpressJS

-Git

-Drupal

Beneficial

-HTML, CSS, and Sass

-Pattern Libraries

-Amazon Web Services (AWS)

-Google Cloud Platform (GCP)

-Software security

-Web Performance

-Software Architecture

-Continuous Delivery

-Automated Testing

Within Aperian, you will work directly with product directors, project managers, founders, technical directors, frontend developers, frontend designers, and contractors.

Other Qualifications:

-Collaborative

-Able to successfully participate in paired programming

-Detail oriented

-Can work quickly and accurately

-Quick learner

-Resourceful

-Clear and articulate communicator

-Strong interpersonal skills

-Bachelors’ in related field or 5 to 7 years of applicable experience

-Occasional travel required

Who Are We? With over 25 years of experience, Aperian Global partners with organizations to develop the skills necessary for success in a global work environment. We provide learning solutions via facilitated programs, online learning tools & consulting services in the areas of Leadership Development, Global Mindset, Team Effectiveness & Global Mobility. For more information, please visit: (http://www.aperianglobal.com.

Why Work For Us? We are a passionate mission and values driven company that trains organizations around the globe to have a better understanding of cultural differences as they conduct business with each other. Our mission is to develop the capabilities of individuals, teams and organizations to perform effectively worldwide in order to create a sustainable global future.

We offer the possibility of working remotely from your home office or in beautiful office surroundings in Oakland, CA as well as competitive compensation and a generous benefits package (14 holidays plus 3 weeks of vacation a year). For more information check us out on our website at http://www.aperianglobal.com.

title: 3D Scientific Visualization Software Engineer
description:
3D Scientific Visualization Software Engineer

Schrödinger, a technology leader specializing in software solutions for life science research and development, is seeking a highly skilled software engineer to help develop the molecular modeling and visualization application central to our solution suites. The ideal candidate is a software engineer with experience developing software in the field of 3D scientific visualization and graphical user interface. The candidate should be familiar with and eager to adopt and share good software engineering practices. Schrödinger has a strong commitment to engineering as well as science and uses continuous integration, extensive testing, and code review as part of our daily practices.

Responsibilities:

--Actively contribute to the design, implementation, and testing of our multi-platform molecular modeling application

--Troubleshoot bugs and improve the performance of our tool

--Collaborate with the team and other departments (UX, QA, support, backends)

Required skills:

--B.S., M.S., or Ph.D. in Computer Science or related field

--Object-oriented design with C++ or Java (the development will be done in C++11)

--Knowledge of 3D graphics rendering and geometry processing

--Ability to write code that is well-designed, modular, maintainable, testable and documented

--Ability to work autonomously

--Good verbal and written communication skills

Pluses:

--We are using the following technologies; any familiarity with them is a plus: git, Qt, C++ boost libraries, OpenGL, VTK, Python, waf, bash, valgrind

--Programming by contract

--Experience with collaborative work

--Experience with unit and automated testing

--Experience with multiplatform development (Linux, macOS, Windows)

--Experience with a large code base

--Experience developing an elaborated UI, event-driven programming

--Knowledge of scientific visualization

--Knowledge of chemistry

Schrödinger, Inc. is an equal opportunity employer.

title: Front End Engineer
description:
Medior Front-end Developer

Eindhoven, Noord-Brabant, Netherlands • Engineering

DESCRIPTION To support StudyPortals' (https://www.studyportals.com/about/) global expansion we are significantly expanding our Engineering team. The team currently consists of Front- and Back-End Engineers, Dev-Ops as well UX Designers, split over multiple scrum teams.

As Front-End Engineer, you will play an important role in enhancing and safeguarding the usability of both our student-facing websites and our internal tools. You will be responsible for taking new ideas from their initial concept to a final implementation by combining our RESTful API with your knowledge of HTML5, CSS3, Service Workers and other JavaScript powered technologies.

You will work in a multidisciplinary scrum team of about five people, cooperating with our graphic designers, UX designers and our Marketing- and University Value teams in order to realize the best implementations possible. In order to measure our effectiveness, we are currently focusing very hard on our continuous deployment process. Adding value to our users with every iteration should be top of mind!

REQUIREMENTS

  • At least a Bachelor’s degree, typically one combining aspects from Computer Science and Interaction Design and at least three full years of work experience as web developer.
  • The ability to write valid, semantically correct, HTML5 and CSS3.
  • You can not only contribute to our vision and roadmap, but you also have experience in building and optimizing high-traffic websites.
  • The ability to quickly visualize your ideas by using either graphical tools (such as Photoshop or Illustrator) or pen and paper prototypes.
  • You believe in a mobile first, responsive approach to web development.
  • Technologies like Sass, Vue.js (or other component based systems), Gulp and Node.js have already spiked your interest and, if you’re not using all of them already, you can’t wait to start using them.
  • You are comfortable with collaboration, open communication and reaching across functional borders as part of your day-to-day work.
  • Fluency in English, both oral and written, and excellent communication skills.
  • Ambition, energetic and an entrepreneurial drive, you can work well independently but definitely also in a team and you are fun to work with.

BENEFITS

  • A fulltime, 40 hours/week, position.
  • Competitive salary including a bonus scheme.

title: Senior Software Engineer in de Mechatronica
description:
Bedrijf: Berg Hortimotive, ontwikkelaar en producent van systemen voor mechanisatie van productie en logistiek
Regio: Vanuit Westland, De Lier, de wereld over

Heb jij ’t vermogen de besturing van machines en logistieke systemen te programmeren? Ben jij klaar om het juiste platform te kiezen en de software voor de nieuwe generatie producten van Berg Hortimotive conform de standaarden die jij juiste acht te ontwikkelen? Dan ben jij degene die ’t bedrijf en klanten in de snel groeiende internationale markten, verder helpt. Wij zijn op zoek naar een

Senior Software Engineer in de Mechatronica
Iemand die ’t overziet en snapt, van hardware naar software schakelt en weer terug

De functie:
Je bouwt nieuwe toepassingen, geeft vorm aan de besturing van bestaande en nieuwe producten en systemen die passen in de Smart Industrie. Je programmeert de steeds intelligentere multi inzetbare wagens welke zich middels ‘GPS’ door de productieruimten bewegen. Het intelligentieniveau van de producten breng je omhoog en je breidt het aantal functionaliteiten uit. De komende jaren bouw je de kennis en capaciteit voor software engineering in de onderneming veder uit, als je wilt wordt jij de Lead Engineer van de discipline in wording.

Daarnaast zal jij je bezig houden met de volgende taken:

  • Je bundelt de kennis die nu bij collega’s intern zit, maar ook kennis die bij leveranciers aanwezig is;
  • Jij wordt dé trekker, de belangrijke verantwoordelijke voor alle software/PC PLC ontwikkelingen;
  • Bestaande besturingsplatformen richt je stap voor stap opnieuw in, je stroomlijnt het gebruik van specifieke talen;
  • Regelmatig verzorg je de in bedrijfstelling van de systemen op projectlocatie in binnen- en buitenland;

Jouw werk geeft invulling aan een hoofdlijn in de toekomstvisie van BergHortimotive: ‘het intelligenter maken van producten en systemen en het genereren, beschikbaar stellen en toepasbaar maken van Big Data voor klanten’.

Heb jij analytische en ‘vertaal’ skills?
We zijn op zoek naar een Software engineer die met een open vizier luisteren kan, zich zelf goed weet uit te drukken zodat optimaal met collega engineers, projectmanagers, R&D medewerkers én met marktpartijen kan worden samengewerkt. Verder haal je enerzijds voldoening uit het programmeren zodat het apparaat doet wat de bedoeling is. Anderzijds behoud jij het overzicht en hecht je er waarde aan om de lijnen waarlangs vandaag en ook de komende jaren ontwikkeld wordt, toekomstbestendig te kiezen.

Verder:

  • Werk- en denk je op HBO niveau, je hebt bijvoorbeeld een opleiding informatica, mechatronica, elektronica, industriële automatisering, (een) programmeur opleiding (en) of andere IT opleidingen doorlopen;
  • Je beheerst de Nederlandse taal, schakelt gemakkelijk over naar ’t Engels en bent bekend met programmeren in onder andere C#, C++ of IEC61131. Dus je bent thuis in PC programmeren en hebt affiniteit met het programmeren van PLC’s, die volgorde is ’t meest waarschijnlijk. Maar andersom kan ook;
  • Je staat stevig in je schoenen, werkt accuraat en vindt het leuk dat (regelmatig) projecten in buitenland worden uitgevoerd;

Werken bij Berg Hortimotive:
Bij Berg Hortimotive leveren we oplossingen voor behoeften in mechanisatie en automatisering van intensieve productie- verwerkings- en logistieke omgevingen in de internationale Horti sector. Het bedrijf heeft een prima marktpositie, een klinkende naam, uitstekende producten, vernieuwende projecten onder handen en flink wat nieuwe producten in de pijplijn. Kernwoorden daarbij zijn: Mechatronica, Internet of things, Big data en Smart industrie. Daarmee zet het bedrijf een flinke stap. Nieuwe Toegevoegde waarde, bovenop haar huidige Picking to Packing concepten.

Nieuwsgierig?
Als je meer wilt weten over BergHortimotive, neem een kijkje op www.berghortimotive.nl en bekijk zeker ook even de bedrijfs- en project filmpjes.

BergHortimotive biedt jou als ervaren Software Engineer de gelegenheid producten en systemen steeds meer software matig, geïntegreerd te laten functioneren. Je krijgt een belangrijke rol in de ‘system intergrate’ activiteiten. Een interessante, uitdagende senior software engineer functie waarbij je met andere (software) engineers, met klanten en met leveranciers en marktpartijen samenwerkt. Je komt in een compact platte, efficiënte, slagvaardige en informele organisatie terecht waarbij jij, als je dat ambieert, de aangewezene bent om stap voor stap leiding te geven aan het team van software ontwikkelaars welke er komende tijd bij komen.

Meer over het aanbod:

  • Werken met diverse technieken en voor een veelzijdig diverse klanten groep in binnen- en buitenland;
  • Een functie bij een prachtig bedrijf met een heldere visie op en een plan voor de toekomst;
  • De mooie uitdaging, jouw passie in mechatronica uitgebreid toe te passen;
  • Passend salarisniveau, smartphone, laptop en goede secundaire voorwaarden;

Interesse of meer weten?
Leidt jij met BergHortimotive, klanten door de wereld heen binnen naar productiewijzen die bij de Smart Industrie horen? Solliciteer dan snel door je CV en motivatie te sturen via de link. Ook voor vragen of het maken van een afspraak kun je hier terecht.

Acquisitie naar aanleiding van deze vacature wordt niet op prijs gesteld.

Trefwoorden: Vacature, fulltime, Rotterdam, senior, software engineer, software developer, softwareontwerper

title: Cloud Infrastructure Engineer
description:
About the Team

Production Engineering is a new department dedicated to ensuring the reliability and performance of Teach To One: Math across all technology areas. The work of the team includes infrastructure engineering, database administration, tools and automation, bug fixing, troubleshooting, and on-call incident response. This team currently supports our legacy platform built on .NET, Node.js (MEAN), Python (Django), and various front end frameworks. As we complete each piece of our next generation platform built on .NET Core and Angular, Production Engineering is responsible for rolling it out (thus replacing its legacy counterpart) and owning it from that point on.

About the Role

Our Cloud Engineer owns the foundation on which our Teach To One: Math program runs. This person designs, builds, and cares for all of our infrastructure across our cloud providers. Modern services, platforms, tools, networks, systems, and best practices are all core to this role, but so is the ability to see each minute detail in the context of the bigger picture. If you enjoy moving seamlessly between the developer and operations mindsets, and having full support from a management team that gets it (including a former SRE), this job is for you.

What You'll Do

  • Manage our current infrastructure on Microsoft Azure and Amazon Web Services.
  • Design, build, and support our next-generation enterprise cloud infrastructure.
  • Create tools to help automate and scale our infrastructure.
  • Implement and automate IaaS, PaaS, and serverless services in Azure and AWS including Virtual Machines / EC2, Functions/Lambda, Logic Apps / Step Functions, SQL Database, Data Warehouse, Blob Storage / S3, etc.
  • Implement and maintain monitoring solutions such as Graylog 2, New Relic, AppDynamics, and Vault.
  • Author and maintain high-quality documentation.
  • Troubleshoot and resolve production issues.
  • Participate in on-call duty.

What We Are Looking For

  • 3+ years of hands-on cloud experience with at least 1 year of experience with Microsoft Azure. Strong understanding of Azure capabilities and limitations.
  • Deep DevOps and troubleshooting experience with Windows and Linux.
  • Deep understanding of code deployment pipelines, continuous integration / continuous delivery systems, and Agile methodology. Experience with deployment strategies using Web Deploy (MSDeploy), Atlassian Bamboo, Git hooks, and triggers.
  • Strong knowledge of PowerCLI/PowerShell and bash.
  • Experience with Chef or an equivalent configuration management system.
  • Extensive knowledge of cloud networking topologies and diagnostics.
  • Thorough understanding of infrastructure (hypervisor, storage, monitoring, security, etc.) and experience with cloud deployment orchestration.
  • Experience architecting infrastructure solutions using both Linux/Unix and Windows with specific recommendations on servers, load balancing, high availability, disaster recovery, and storage architectures.
  • Experience with Active Directory troubleshooting and maintenance. Experience with Azure Active Directory is a plus.
  • Expertise in any of our stacks is a plus. Our Teach to One: Math platform runs on .NET, Node.js (MEAN), and Python (Django), all backed by MS SQL Server, MongoDB, and PostgreSQL.
  • Exemplary written and verbal communication skills.
  • Grace under pressure and a sense of urgency.

Application Information

Equal Opportunity

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, race, creed, color, national origin, ancestry, marital status, affectional or sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, disability, nationality or sex.

Work Authorization

In compliance with federal law, all persons hired will be required to verify identity and eligibility to work in the United States and to complete the required employment eligibility verification
